fr.sorbonne_u.components.pubsub.components

Class Broker

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sorbonne_u.components.pubsub.components.Broker

  • public class Broker
extends java.lang.Object
    A Broker is the heart of a PubSub component, in fact The PubSub class delegate all its operations to the Broker class.

    The Broker class needs to maximize the parallelism of handling asynchronously publishing and subscribing requests from other components and it does so by using two executors:

    1. PublisherExecutor: This executor handles publishing messages to the subscribers.
    2. SubscriberExecutor: This executor handles all requests coming from subscribers such as subscribe, unsubscribe etc.

    All this class methods could have been embedded directly in the PubSub component, but if we did so, the class would become hard to test. Since all requests are handled asynchronously, returning a CompletableFuture for each method is an obligation to maintain testing the features of this class.

    Note that the class is not responsible for creating Subscribable instances, it is up to the user of this class to create them, i.e a PubSub class, or a test class

    See Also:
    PubSub, PublisherExecutor, SubscriberExecutor

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      protected Broker()
      Creates a new broker instance with default parallelism equals to 10 for both the subscriberExecutor and the publisherExecutor.
      protected Broker(int subscribingParallelism, int publishingParallelism)
      Creates a new broker instance with specific parallelism values for both the subscriberExecutor and the publisherExecutor.

      • removeTopic

        protected java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture<java.lang.Void> removeTopic(Topic topic)
        Delete a topic.

        When deleting a topic it is not guaranteed that all the subscribers to this topic will get the messages published on this topic at this moment.
